abstract.p: Roundup of travel news; Congress Hall, resort undergoing restoration in Cape May, NJ, offers tours that include rooms decorated as they were in past; Silversea Cruises offers daily personalized fax service that keeps track of performance of guest's investment portfolio; guidebook lists London pubs, restaurants, hotels and attractions that allow smoking (S)

block.p: Cape May, at the southeastern tip of New Jersey, is like a living outdoor museum of vacationing, with its seaside Victorian mansions and giant old resorts. One of those resorts, which is under restoration, is providing a closer look at seaside hospitality over the years.

Cape May, at the southeastern tip of New Jersey, is like a living outdoor museum of vacationing, with its seaside Victorian mansions and giant old resorts. One of those resorts, which is under restoration, is providing a closer look at seaside hospitality over the years.

Congress Hall -- built in 1816, rebuilt in 1879 and scheduled to reopen completely in 2000 -- offers 45-minute tours 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. Thursday to Monday that include guest rooms decorated as they were in 1880, 1920 and 1950 (as well as a prototype of the new rooms). Tours cost $7. A wing with 22 shops is already open. Call (609) 884-8421.

Some go to sea to get away from it all; others want to stay on top of the investments that helped pay for the trip. For the latter, Silversea Cruises has Financial Fax, a daily personalized record that tracks up to 30 stocks, mutual funds and options, delivered to a guest at the close of markets. Available on the Silver Cloud and Silver Wind, the service costs $6 a day.
For application forms, call Silverseas at (800) 722-9055. Guests who are hit by a severe market downturn are advised to keep their life jackets on.

For those who don't mind some cigarette smoke mixed with the London fog, there is ''The Forest Guide to Smoking in London'' (Seven Hills Books, $12.95). It is a paperback that lists pubs, restaurants, hotels and sightseeing attractions that allow smoking and the limits they impose. Among its humorous touches is a guide to London's doorways, since that's where many smokers are likely to find themselves when they indulge. Call (800) 545-2005 to order ($3.50 extra for shipping).
